title: Ask Me Anything - HR Professional with 15+ years experience :)
content: Ask Me Anything - HR Professional with 15+ years experience :)

comments.body:
Hey, not sure if this is real.

One question i would like to ask is, How has AI shaped your Hiring experience as an HR, be it in a positive or negative way?   
and what are some hurdles u face commonly in hiring process?

AI is yet to make an impact on hiring process. There are automation tools being used by most organisations to filter resumes even before all these AI hype. What I have observed is candidates are able to prepare well with the help of AI basis the organisation they are applying for jobs.
Hi Sir/Ma'am,Are you looking to hire?

How much does English fluency matter? Do companies only hire students with polished English

What do companies look for in resumes during college placements( companies like Big4) ?

Which non-tech career pays well? especially in startups.

Is analytics field getting affected by AI like is hiring down in these fields?

1. Matters a lot for general management roles. Tech roles the influence is low but having high proficiency in English language is an advantage for any type of job / interviews. 
2. Have the basic details in order and structured. Mention about the project / internship about experience clearly if you are a fresher. Role or resume is limited for campus interviews. 
3. Product Management 
4. Impact is yet to be assessed. My visibility is limited. But analytics has high chances of getting impacted due to the nature of function.

Chances are very low. The best way to get your self shortlisted for an interview is through referrals. LinkedIn is the best forum for the same. Well prepared and specific requests to potential connects make the difference.
We do hire. Fresh graduate hiring is through campus programs.

Have a bunch of questions, would love to discuss some over DM as well! 

1. What trends are you noticing in the tech job market, particularly for freshers and junior developers?

2. Are there specific companies or sectors actively hiring for backend/ML roles right now?

3. When exploring job opportunities, is it more effective to connect directly with the hiring team or reach out to HR first? Are there situations where one approach works better than the other?

4. What are some effective strategies for negotiating salary with HR? Are there key points or techniques that can improve the chances of securing a better offer?

5. During conversations with HR, what important factors should I keep in mind? Additionally, in situations like layoffs, how can one navigate the discussion to avoid feeling pressured or manipulated to take a low ball offer?

who is laid off, for how long does the gap in resume work (1/3/6 months?)
